The arrangement was such that one legion (probably the loth) formed the right wing, two legions the cartre, and one legion the leit wing; the legions were in the same line. This is of importante, because the triple line oi Caesar is commonly misunderstood; if the legion is considered as the tactical unit, there is but one line; but the cohorts oi each legion were arranged in three lines. The celebrated triplex acies is, then, the order of battle, according to which the ten cohorts, oi which each legion was made up, were stationed in three lines, one behind the other; ordinarily four heingin the frent line, three in the second, and three in the third, a suitable space being left between the cohorte.
